website_summaries.verdict: Not a fact-filled CFA exam study guide as such, but potential test candidates receive objective insights from an experienced CFA insider. Easy to read, with a good conversational tone.
pros: Author provides many informative personal anecdotes
Good preparation for the CFA test taking process itself
Honest pros and cons of the entire CFA journey
cons: Not an in-depth CFA study guide, but insights from an insider
Much of the information is available elsewhere
Expensive price point for a Kindle e-book

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is required reading if you are thinking of pursuing the CFA designation. Greg is very honest and upfront about what it takes to pass these brutal exams as well as a few strategic points which are not to be overlooked. The chapter on CFA vs. MBA will be quite useful to those thinking about a career in Finance and which option to choose or perhaps both. Having passed 2 of these exams and getting ready for Level 3 exam next June, I can tell you that many of his suggestions are right on point.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Lomenzo

customer_reviews.title: This book is a great start for anyone considering the CFA program.
customer_reviews.text: For anyone thinking of taking the CFA exams or if you are going through the program, then this book is for you. The author shares his struggles and in this way provides an insight in the mind of a CFA candidate. If you are considering taking the CFA exams then this book gives you a good insight of what to expect and what toll it can take on your personal life. I thoroughly enjoyed reading about the author's struggles (in a non-sadistic way should I add).
customer_reviews.author: Frederik Kerckhof

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Practical overview on decision-making about your path to become a Charter holder. This will be your guiding Bible before you embark on your journey. The go-to book for anyone deciding the plunge into the cold waters of Level I, II, III, and then of course your 4 years of experience :)
customer_reviews.author: Viral T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend CFA Confidential
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed Greg's book. Since I'm not in finance myself I have never actually known anyone who holds the CFA charter nor anyone who's actually taken one of the exams either, so his honesty and openness about his own struggles with the path to the charter were illuminating to me personally.. I also gained some very practical tips about timelines to preparation, etc. I think this book occupies a unique or niche space in this particular area. I'd encourage anyone involved with the CFA pursuit either past or present to read the book. Thanks for writing it Greg!!
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Great resource of information
customer_reviews.text: It is great to read a book written by CFA person who has a real life (job, family) and conditions for studying as majority of us. I really recommend to read this book for everyone deciding to sign up for CFA journey
customer_reviews.author: Jitka

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great book.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first book I read about the CFA and I can tell you he did not leave any part of the basic process out, and mostly what to expect when going to the certification. Absolutely great book.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Persohn

customer_reviews.title: Straight to the point
customer_reviews.text: No corners and shortcut advise. Wana make it goto work hard at it and study - how you study is tests tests tests
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Very useful practical tips how to approach the exams
customer_reviews.text: Very useful practical tips how to approach the exams. It really helped me to improve my exam preparation. After reading CFA Confidential I passed all the residual exams in my first attempt. I recommend this book to every CFA Candidate!
customer_reviews.author: Gijs Hermens

customer_reviews.title: well-written and informative
customer_reviews.text: I felt as if I were living Gregory's experience with the CFA program step by step, which is a sign of a good writer. He approaches each success and each failure with a sense of humor and an ability to learn and grow. As a CFA Level III candidate who has experienced my share of ups and downs myself, I was able to nod my head and feel much of what Gregory was going through. I would highly recommend this book to anyone who wants to meet a difficult challenge and prosper, overcoming disappointment along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: If your thinking CFA then read this first.
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking CFA. I was thinking I knew what I needed to learn and what I already knew. CFA Confidential cleared the fog. This is a great little read that provides real clarity for anyone contemplating or engaged in the the process of gaining a CFA. Greg Champion is funny and remarkably honest and thoughtful when it comes to sharing his failures as he struggled to attain his CFA. Congratulations Greg. A great book. I'm grateful you wrote it.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Barter

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book to read even before we make a decision ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book to read even before we make a decision whether to pursue for CFA. By reading this book, I learned about the hardships I may face during my preparation for my each CFA exams. This book prepared me mentally and motivated me to work hard on my own.Thanks for the writer for sharing all of his personal experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: An important read.
customer_reviews.text: A must read for all the underdogs thinking about entering into a lonely war with themselves that is called the CFA.
customer_reviews.author: Zeeshan Joomuck

customer_reviews.title: Great book if you're a young professional deciding whether or ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book if you're a young professional deciding whether or not the CFA is the right career path for you. Outlines the different sacrifices one would have to make and makes the advantages clear!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Simply brilliant !!!
customer_reviews.text: If u r not sure whether to take cfa exam us must read this book. Simply brilliant. Gregory Campion is very honest about his experiences. He is also very funny and down to earth. Great read
customer_reviews.author: Krzysztof Wojtas

customer_reviews.title: very informative
customer_reviews.text: Very well written and informative book. Good intro to what is awaiting me on the CFA exams. And the stark reality about the trails and tribulations he went through
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Ephrem

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful and informative
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is a must read before you actually enroll in the CFA. The author's personal experience was very helpful and inspirational.
customer_reviews.author: Yaseen

customer_reviews.title: Very high-level overview of the process
customer_reviews.text: I read this book as I was deciding on whether to embark myself on the CFA program. It's a decent read to understand, at a basic level, the commitment required to take the CFA exams and for this reason I wouldn't rate it less than 3 stars. This said, it won't provide much more info than what you can find on articles or blogs online, for free. Very overpriced at $10 for a kindle book. I highly encourage you to check out the free sample before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: On Point!
customer_reviews.text: I find Mr. Campion's account of his experience refreshing, as it is similar to mine. He's honest, and on point about every sacrifice and all the disruptions that can take you off course. Additionally, I've implented some great recommendations he made and as a result, I'm counting on passing my level on the next attempt. Káon Nelson, CFP®
customer_reviews.author: Kaon Nelson

customer_reviews.title: great book to get you to the CFA path
customer_reviews.text: After reading the book it made want to fully pursue the CFA path. The book provides some good things and also the challenges that come along with pursuing the CFA. I enjoyed the honesty behind this book
customer_reviews.author: The Crew

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be more of an anecdote than useful tips and tricks. I didn't read much of it as I was turned off early-on in the book.
customer_reviews.author: greenblues

customer_reviews.title: Hope for CFA Hopefuls
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing! Mr. Campion humorously addresses the horror that is the CFA. This book provided many valuable insights along with some much needed comic relief. There is hope!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Really a must read for anyone wishing to pursue the CFA designation
customer_reviews.text: The book is very well written and it gives a lot of really good advice for anyone who is thinking or is in the midst of pursuing the CFA designation. Obviously, i'd reccomend the book to all the people who already achieved the charter as the book is very good at refreshing all the emotions lived durint the CFA experience!
customer_reviews.author: denis manzi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good book! Need to read for CFA! Great seller as well
customer_reviews.author: Sunghwan Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good sense of humour, informative, and a must-read for CFA candidates.
customer_reviews.text: I found the "CFA Confidential: What it Really Takes to Become a Chartered Financial Analyst" very intriguing, primarily because Mr. Campion shares his experience with figthing the beasts (the exams), and you can indeed relate to the pain he has been through. Personally, I've only sat for one exam, but I suppose the book provides a very clear-cut image of what you can expect if you decide to go for the CFA charter, or even if you are right in the middle of it. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: CFA Confidential
customer_reviews.text: I've followed @CFAConfidential on twitter for awhile and was excited that they were coming out with a full book. The book is different because it's based on the personal experience that the author had with the CFA program. I think it's a very realistic take on the whole process. The CFA vs. MBA chapter was really interesting for me because I had been going back and forth between which one to get. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this book. It's a really easy read and when you're studying for CFA exams, you don't have a lot of extra time to read books, so I like that's short and to the point.
customer_reviews.author: Asmith123

customer_reviews.title: Clear view of the harsh reality
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the personal story as much as the specifics. The book offers a clearer idea of what the quest for my CFA will be.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Good read but a little light
customer_reviews.text: Good points of reference if you're someone like me considering the CFA designation. It seems to lay out the profession and program in a straightforward way, but it could probably go into a little more detail in places. Still a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Oren M

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: It is way too brief and general, looks more like a book that describe the journey through CFA rather than a guide with tips.
customer_reviews.author: Eloi
